result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P Clark Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge

***PER 6-30-2016 ORDER - Attorney fees in the amount of $634.47 added***
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two as approved by the Agent
--not to transfer probation out of state without prior court approval

--to make all child support payments on time

--to make all payments on arrearages according to the Child Support orders

--All payments toward child support and arrearages are to be paid through: Wisconsin Support Collection Trust Fund, Box 74200, Milwaukee WI 53274-0200 not through the Department of Corrections

--to undergo any type of assessment, treatment, therapies and counseling as required by the Agent

--to advise Child Support Enforcement Agency of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such change

--within 5 days report to Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 S. Center Ave. Jefferson WI 53549. Rm229 to set up a case management meeting

--provide DNA sample upon request

--Court recommends out-of-state travel in order to accommodate Mr. Clark's employment

Arresting Agency: Jefferson County Child Support Services

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:01 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Michael P Clark in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2
ADA Shock submits victim impact statement

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 and 1/2 years, with conditions:
--to make all child support payments on time
--to make all payments on arrearages according to the Child Support orders
--All payments toward child support and arrearages are to be paid through: Wisconsin Support Collection Trust Fund, Box 74200, Milwaukee WI 53274-0200 not through the Department of Corrections
--to pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge
--repayment of attorney fees
--to undergo any type of assessment, treatment, therapies and counseling as required by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two as approved by the Agent
--to advise Child Support Enforcement Agency of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such change
--within 5 days report to Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 S. Center Ave. Jefferson WI 53549. Rm229 to set up a case management meeting
--provide DNA sample upon request
--not to transfer probation out of state without prior court approval
--Court recommends out-of-state travel in order to accommodate Mr. Clark's employment
APPLY CASH BOND

Days Credit for Time Served Given: 2 days
Felony firearm and voting prohibition warnings given

Court orders that the Defendant's SSN be redacted from letter submitted by defense prior to be scanned into CCAP
Recess: 11:22 am
Status conference on June 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.
FINANCIAL NOTES:  $100.00 Attorney fee received via gps

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Request for Judicial Substitution pursuant to WIS STAT 971.20(4)

Case called at 9:18am [mo]
Defendant Michael P Clark in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr.Clark waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

The State has filed an Information

Atty. Humes files a motion for susbstitution
The Court finds the request is timely and in the proper form. The Court directs the Clerk to request the assignment of another Judge under Wis. Stat. 751.03
recess: 9:23am
Repayment at the rate of $100 per month until the total sum is paid. The first payment shall be made on 3-2-2016. Payments shall be made to the Clerk of Court

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:00am [mo]
Defendant Michael P Clark in court.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

The Court reviews the Court Record
Upon inquiry of the Court, Mr. Clark indicates that he has not yet filed a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel
The Court gives Mr. Clark his right to Counsel
recess: 10:06am--reconvene:10:49am (to allow Mr. Clark to complete Petition)

The Court finds that Mr. Clark is indigent.
The Court orders Mr. Clark to pay towards attorney fees at the rate of $100 per month, beginning on 3/2/16 and on the 2nd day of each month until further direction by the Court.

recess: 10:51am

NEXT: Status Conference on 4/26/16 at 9:00am

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:25pm [mo]
Defendant Michael P Clark Sr. appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann(For Bond Purposes ONLY).   Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Hagemann indicates that Mr. Clark is not eligible for SPD representation. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The verifies the Defendant's date of birth and address of the Criminal Complaint.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
RIght to Counsel given
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $150 CASH bond, with conditions:
--booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today
recess 1:30 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 12/9/15 at 10:20am   (2) Status Conference on 2/2/16 at 10:00am

[MK] case called at 3:23pm. 
Defendant Michael P Clark not in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court summarizes the letter received from Mr. Clark which indicates that he learned of this hearing last week and only received the Summons on July 18th and is requesting a later court date.
ADA Hall notes that that there is a warrant pending for Mr. Clark in Marathon County. ADA Hall motions for the issuance of a probable cause warrant.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court orders issuance of a Probable Cause Warrant for Mr. Clark- body only, and extraditable. 
recess 3:25pm.
Letter from the defendant requesting a different initial appearance date
